intro: Anthemis anglica, commonly known as common tansy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and features narrow, gray-green leaves with a distinctive silvery-blue underside. Its flowers bloom in yellow to orange hues, often appearing in clusters at the ends of the stems. The plant is known for its strong, aromatic scent and has been used historically in herbal medicine and as a companion plant in gardens.
